channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Acoustic generation of orbital currents
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 29 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-62703-z

The orbital Hall effect has recently been shown to produce orbital torques, allowing for the efficient driving of magnetization by light metals such as titanium. Here, Taniguchi et al show that orbital currents can also be generated by surface acoustic waves, showing this in a titanium/nickel bilayer.
item.dc:title: Acoustic generation of orbital currents
item.dc:creator: Mari Taniguchi
Satoshi Haku
Hyun-Woo Lee
Kazuya Ando

item.title: Observation of triplet-assisted long-distance charge-transfer exciton transport in single organic cocrystal
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 29 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63388-0

Charge-transfer states with long transport distances in organic cocrystals have only been observed at nanoscale so far. Here, the authors report its direct observation at micron scale and reveal a triplet assisted transport mechanism to improve optoelectronic material design and device optimization.
item.dc:title: Observation of triplet-assisted long-distance charge-transfer exciton transport in single organic cocrystal
item.dc:creator: Yejun Xiao
Xianchang Yan
Rui Cai
Xuan Liu
Jingwen Bao
Min Zhang
Jing Leng
Shengye Jin
Wenming Tian
